title: Test-Optional Admission Information  · Angelo State University
description: Learn about Angelo State’s test-optional admission policy—explore your options and find out how to apply without standardized test scores.

paragraphs: Angelo State has a test-optional admission policy for students.
You may feel that an SAT or ACT score does not fully reflect your academic potential. Our policy gives you the option to apply to Angelo State without consideration of SAT or ACT scores.

When you apply throughApplyTexas, please indicate whether you would like to be considered for admission without your SAT or ACT scores. If you select to have your application reviewed without your test scores, ASU will review your application using other criteria, which may include, but are not limited to, demonstrated academic rigor, leadership, dual credit course completion, college readiness criteria, or any other consideration of applicants.
You are guaranteed admission into Angelo State if you are graduating from an accredited high school and meet one of the following qualifications:

Students from accredited high schools qualify for automatic admission with the combination of graduating class rank and high school GPA shown below. If you are in the 2nd quarter and do not meet the GPA requirement or are ranked in the 3rd or 4th quarter, your file will be reviewed holistically (see File Review section below).

* Recommended Program or the Distinguished Level of Achievement on the Foundation High School Program**Recommended or Distinguished Achievement Program or the Endorsements or Distinguished Level of Achievement on the Foundation High School Program or its equivalent

If you do not meet the assured admission criteria above, your file will be reviewed. Your file will be evaluated for intellectual curiosity and academic rigor, demonstrated leadership and problem-solving ability, contributions to community, socioeconomic background and family responsibilities, special talents and awards, and variety of experience and background.
You are encouraged to submit the additional items listed below. However, ASU will also reach out to your high school counselor to gather as much information as possible to review your application.

If you were evaluated without an ACT/SAT score and are denied admission, you may choose to submit a test score and will be automatically re-reviewed for admission with the score being considered. Sign up for the national ACT/SAT test or the ACT residual test at ASU, and have your scores sent to the Angelo State.
If you apply as test-optional, you will still be considered for anASU Distinguished Scholarship.
Office of Admissions325-942-2041admissions@angelo.eduHardeman Student Services Building, Room 101
If you want to go fast, go alone. But if you want to go far, go together.

Dual Credit Transcripts: If you took dual credit, you should request an official transcript directly from the college/university providing the college credit. Please do not email college transcripts. Visit ourtranscript resources pagefor links on how to order transcripts from other Texas colleges and universities.
TSI Scores: Submit your TSI scores totsi@angelo.eduor allow ASU to access your TSI scores by filling out theTSIA Release Form.
PSAT NMSQT Scores: Contact your high school counselor to request your PSAT NMSQT score to be sent to ASU
STAAR End of Course (EOC) Scores: Contact your high school counselor to request your STAAR EOC scores to be sent to ASU.
